intro: Leontodon runcinatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are linear and often have a distinctive serrated edge, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Leontodon runcinatus is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters.
